meanings.definition: The belief that one race is superior to another.
meanings.sent1: Racemisms can lead to harmful stereotypes and unfair treatment.
meanings.sent2: The history of racism is filled with examples of racemisms causing division and injustice.
meanings.sent3: Some people's racemisms are so extreme that they refuse to see the value in diversity.
meanings.sent4: In a world without racemisms, we would all be judged by our character and actions, not our skin color.
meanings.sent5: The impact of racemisms on society can be devastating, leading to deep-seated inequalities and tensions.

meanings.definition: Discrimination or prejudice based on race.
meanings.sent1: Racemisms have no place in a fair and just society.
meanings.sent2: The effects of racemisms can be seen in various aspects of life, from education to employment.
meanings.sent3: It is important to confront and address any instances of racemisms to promote equality and understanding.
meanings.sent4: The roots of racemisms run deep, but with education and empathy, they can be overcome.
meanings.sent5: Experiencing racemisms firsthand can be a wake-up call to the realities of systemic discrimination.
